title: Epic: Godot Project Setup & Web Export
description: Initialize Godot 4 project, configure for web (HTML5) export targeting mobile browsers. Set up project structure (scenes, scripts, resources directories). Configure viewport for vertical mobile (portrait orientation, touch input). Placeholder main scene. Verify web export builds and runs in mobile browser.

title: Play validation: single, pair, triple, quad, run, bomb
description: Implement combo detection functions: isSingle, isPair, isTriple, isQuad, isRun (3+ consecutive, no 2s, runs go indefinitely), isBomb (3+ consecutive pairs). DetermineCombo function returns combo type or INVALID. isSuited check for suited runs. Reference: thirteen/src/Game/Play
close_reason: MoveValidator with opening/standard/chop validation, suited run enforcement

title: Turn manager: human/bot turn cycling with UI updates
description: Orchestrate turn flow. On human turn: enable card selection and play/pass buttons, validate play on submit. On bot turn: brief delay, bot selects play, animate it. Update whose-turn indicator. Handle round reset when all pass (power to last player). Handle player going out.

title: Bot strategy improvements (currently greedy)
description: Bots currently use simple greedy strategy (play lowest card). Consider enhancing with: (1) Strategic passing to save better combos, (2) Memory of what's been played, (3) End-game optimization. Low priority - greedy works for MVP.

title: Implement player authentication and identity
description: Add player authentication: (1) Anonymous player IDs (UUID-based), (2) Optional username/display name, (3) Session management, (4) Token-based auth for WebSocket connections, (5) Future: social login (Google/Apple/etc) hooks

title: Play validation feedback
description: Show visual feedback when player attempts invalid plays. Display error message explaining why play is invalid (wrong combo type, not high enough, etc.). Should be clear and helpful.

title: Integrate ONNX Runtime in Lambda for server-side bots
description: Deploy trained models to Lambda: (1) Package ONNX Runtime in Lambda layer (~50MB), (2) Load model from S3 on cold start (cache in /tmp), (3) Inference endpoint for bot move computation, (4) Input: game state features, Output: action (cards to play), (5) Latency optimization: provisioned concurrency, keep-warm pings, (6) Support multiple model versions (A/B testing), (7) Fallback to greedy if inference fails

title: Implement tournament seat claiming and scoring
description: Implement single-tournament system: (1) Global tourney singleton in DynamoDB with scoring and ready states, (2) Claim seat API (specific seat 0-3 or first available), (3) Leave tourney API (free seat before start, bot replacement after), (4) Ready-up system (all 4 players must ready before each game), (5) Tourney state broadcast to all players, (6) Multi-game scoring (4/2/1/0 points for 1st/2nd/3rd/4th), (7) Between-game leaderboard display (wait for ready-ups), (8) Tournament completion when player reaches 21 points (manual reset required)

title: Position top opponent cards half off-screen
description: The opponent across from the player (TOP position) should have their cards positioned half off-screen like the left/right opponents. Currently anchor_top=0.0 and anchor_bottom=0.13 keeps them fully on-screen. Need to shift these anchors upward so approximately half the card height extends above the viewport.

title: Implement vanilla RL training with simple rewards
description: Build simple RL baseline: (1) Reward shaping: +1 per card shed, +10 for winning hand, -1 for invalid move attempt, (2) Algorithm: DQN or REINFORCE, (3) Self-play training, (4) Simpler model than PPO for comparison, (5) Export to ONNX, (6) Evaluation: compare to PPO and imitation

title: Game over screen: finish order and replay
description: When game ends (1 player left), show finish order (1st through 4th) with player names. Option to start a new game. Simple screen, placeholder styling.

title: Last played cards in play area are selectable
description: Cards shown in the play area (last played hand) can be selected and lifted up via touch/click. They should not be interactive. Issue: card_sprite uses _input() for global input handling, which bypasses mouse_filter=IGNORE set on play area cards.

title: Edge case handling: round resets and mid-round wins
description: Handle edge cases: (1) Round resets when all other players pass - last player gets 'power' to play anything, (2) Player wins mid-round - continue round with remaining players, (3) Multiple players going out in same round - track correct finish order.

title: Turn indicator UI: show whose turn it is
description: Currently shows 'Waiting for Player X...' for bots and 'Your turn - play anything\!' when player has power. Missing: Clear visual indicator when it's the human player's regular turn (non-power state). Should show 'Your Turn' or similar in the play area.
close_reason: Button state changes (grey to red/green) already provide clear turn indication

title: Epic: Game Flow & Session
description: Wire together game logic, bots, and UI into a playable session. Deal screen, turn management (whose turn indicator, bot auto-play with brief delay), pass button, play validation feedback, win/out detection, game over screen showing finish order (1st-4th). Handle edge cases: player wins mid-round, round resets when all pass, etc.

title: Game state machine: rounds, passing, power, win detection
description: State: lastPlay, playersInRound, playersInGame, winOrder, log. Round flow: when all others pass, active player gets power (lastPlay cleared). Pass removes player from round. When player empties hand, they're out (added to winOrder). Game ends when 1 player remains. Turn order cycles through playersInRound, skipping passed/won players. Reference: thirteen/src/Game/index.js

title: Implement real-time game state synchronization
description: Implement bidirectional game state sync: (1) Client sends moves to server, (2) Server validates and broadcasts to all players, (3) Handle concurrent moves and race conditions, (4) Efficient delta updates (don't send full state), (5) Handle player disconnects mid-game, (6) Game state recovery on reconnect

title: Replace placeholder card sprites with proper card art
description: Current cards are placeholder rectangles with text. Replace with proper card sprites: (1) Source/create card art assets (52 cards + card back), (2) Update card_sprite.gd to load sprite assets instead of drawing text, (3) Ensure cards are mobile-friendly and readable at small sizes, (4) Maintain card scaling logic for different hand sizes. Consider using royalty-free card deck or simple minimalist design for MVP.

title: Add WebSocket client to Godot game
description: Integrate WebSocket networking into Godot client: (1) WebSocket connection management, (2) Message serialization/deserialization, (3) Connect game logic to network events, (4) Handle connection states (connecting/connected/disconnected), (5) Reconnection logic with exponential backoff, (6) UI for connection status

title: Player hand visible behind play history overlay
description: When the play history drawer is open, the player's hand at the bottom is still visible. It should be hidden or obscured by the overlay's semi-transparent background. Issue: player_hand.gd has z_index=100 but play_history_drawer doesn't set a higher z_index.

title: Deal animation and game start
description: Simple deal sequence: shuffle animation (optional), cards fly to each player position. Identify starting player (has 3 of spades). Transition to play state. Can be minimal for MVP.

title: Pass button UI and logic
description: Add pass button for player to skip their turn. Button should only be enabled when it's player's turn. Passing locks player out of round until reset. Update UI state accordingly.

title: Epic: UI/UX (Mobile-First)
description: Build the Godot UI for mobile-first vertical play. Player hand at bottom (horizontal scroll or drawer for 13 cards), play area in center showing last played hand prominently, tap/click play history to review past hands in round. Card sprites are placeholder (rectangles with rank/suit text). Must handle variable-length hands (shrink cards for 10+ card runs). One-hand vertical experience.

title: Card sprite: placeholder rectangle with rank/suit text
description: Godot scene for a card. Rectangle with rounded corners, rank text (3,4,...,K,A,2) and suit symbol. Color-code by suit (red for hearts/diamonds, black for spades/clubs). Must support selected state (visual highlight, slight raise). Must scale down for large hands. Touch/click target.

title: Player hand UI: horizontal scroll at bottom of viewport
description: Display player's 13 cards in a horizontally scrollable row at bottom of screen. Cards slightly overlap when many. Tap to select/deselect (toggle). Selected cards raise up. Support for viewing full hand. One-hand vertical mobile experience.

title: Play area: center display with last played hand
description: Center of screen shows the last played hand prominently. Cards arranged clearly (fan or row). Show who played it. When no active play (power), show 'Your turn - play anything' or 'Waiting for Player X'. Tap/click to open play history drawer showing all plays in current round.

title: Play history drawer
description: Tappable overlay that shows chronological list of all plays in current round. Each entry shows: player name, combo type, cards played (shrunk to fit). Scrollable. Shows passes too. Dismiss by tapping outside or swiping down.

title: Design RL training infrastructure and data collection
description: Design reinforcement learning infrastructure: (1) Define hand-crafted state features (hand encoding, opponent counts, last play, cards played), (2) Define action space (enumerate all valid plays), (3) Three model variants planned: imitation learning from human games, PPO with position rewards (4/2/1/0), vanilla RL with simple rewards, (4) ONNX format for cross-platform deployment (Lambda + Godot), (5) Server-side bot inference for multiplayer (Lambda), client-side for local games, (6) Self-play infrastructure for data generation, (7) Training framework selection (PyTorch/TensorFlow)

title: Invert play history order (newest first)
description: Play history drawer should show the most recent play at the top, with older plays below. Currently shows chronological order. User should scroll down to see earlier plays in the round.

title: Integrate ONNX Runtime in Godot for local bots
description: Embed ONNX models in Godot client: (1) Find or build GDExtension wrapper for ONNX Runtime, (2) Package model file with game (~5-10MB), (3) Load model at game start, (4) Inference: state features â†’ ONNX â†’ action, (5) Fallback to greedy if model load fails, (6) Platform support: Windows, Mac, Linux (web optional), (7) Model selection UI (greedy vs RL bot difficulty)

title: Implement hand-crafted state feature extraction
description: Build feature extraction for RL models: (1) Card encoding (52-dim one-hot per card in hand), (2) Hand sizes for all 4 players, (3) Last play encoding (combo type, high card), (4) Cards played tracker (52-dim binary for which cards are out), (5) Game state features (current player, passed mask, position), (6) Export as numpy array for training, (7) Implement in both Python (training) and GDScript (validation)

close_reason: MoveValidator with opening/standard/chop validation, suited run enforcement

title: Configure web (HTML5) export and verify on mobile

title: Fix mouse click detection on cards
description: Recent commits (a2df220, d3ec926) to fix mobile drag scrolling changed from _gui_input to _input and only handle touch events. Mouse clicks (InputEventMouseButton) are not being handled, breaking desktop interaction. Need to add mouse event handling to _input() and _is_event_over_card().
close_reason: Added mouse event handling to _input() and _is_event_over_card(). Now handles both InputEventMouseButton (for clicks) and InputEventMouseMotion (for drag detection) in addition to existing touch events. Tested and working.

Multiple model variants: (1) Imitation learning from human tournament data, (2) PPO with position-based rewards, (3) Vanilla RL with simple game rewards, (4) Self-play trained models. Deploy trained models as Lambda inference or static policies.

title: Shift opponent hands half off-screen for more play area space
description: Currently the left and right opponent hands are fully visible on-screen (anchored 0.0-0.23 and 0.77-1.0). Shift them so they're only half visible to create more space in the center for the play area. This will improve the mobile UX by giving more room for played cards.
close_reason: Shifted left and right opponent hands to be half off-screen (anchors adjusted from 0.0-0.23 and 0.77-1.0 to -0.115-0.115 and 0.885-1.115). Updated play_area.gd boundary constants to match. Tested and working.

title: Epic: Simple Bot AI
description: Implement basic bot players that can make valid moves. Bots need to: evaluate their hand, choose a valid play that beats the current play (or pass), and handle opening moves. Start with a simple greedy strategy (play lowest valid combo). 3 bots fill the remaining seats for the 1-human MVP.

title: Bot: hand evaluation and valid play enumeration
description: Given a bot's hand and the current lastPlay (or null for opening), enumerate all valid plays the bot could make. Group cards by rank and identify all singles, pairs, triples, quads, runs of various lengths, and bombs. Filter to only those that beat lastPlay.

title: Bot: greedy play strategy
description: Simple bot strategy: from valid plays, choose the lowest-value play that beats the current hand. If opening, play the lowest single. If no valid plays, pass. Add small random delay before playing to simulate thinking. This is intentionally simple -- smarter AI comes later with RL.

title: Playing area clears incorrectly when player passes
description: When a player passes, the playing area is being cleared, but it should remain visible to show what the last play was. Players need to see the current play they're trying to beat, even after others have passed.
notes: Root cause: play_area.gd:show_waiting() clears cards. Fix: preserve last played hand when showing waiting status.

title: Build model evaluation and benchmarking system
